br.usp.poli.takiyama.prv
Class CountingFormula

java.lang.Object
  br.usp.poli.takiyama.prv.CountingFormula
All Implemented Interfaces:
Prv, Replaceable<Prv>
public final class CountingFormula
extends java.lang.Object
implements Prv

Definition by [Kisynski, 2010]:

A counting formula is of the form #A:CA[f(...,A,...)], where:

  • A is a logical variable that is bound by the # sign
  • C is a set of inequality constraints involving A
  • f(...,A,...) is a parameterized random variable.

    The value of #A:CA[f(...,A,...)], given an assignment of values to random variables v, is the histogram function hv : range(f) → N defined by v(#A:CA[f(...,A,...)]) = hv(x) = |{a ∈ (D(A):C) : v(f(...,a,...)) = x}|, where x is in the range of f.

    Author:
    Felipe Takiyama

    getInstance

    public static CountingFormula getInstance(LogicalVariable bound,
                                          Prv prv,
                                          java.util.Set<Constraint> constraints)
                                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
    Returns a counting formula.

    Parameters:
    boundVariable - The logical variable bound to this counting formula (that is, the variable being counted)
    constraints - A set of constraints involving the bound logical variable
    prv - The parameterized random variable associated with this counting formula.
    Returns:
    A counting formula
    Throws:
    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the set of constraints contains a constraint not involving the bound logical variable or if the specified logical variable is not a parameter of the specified parameterized random variable.

    getCount

    public int getCount(RangeElement histogram,
                    RangeElement bucket)
    Returns the count of bucket for the specified Histogram. If the specified histogram is not a Histogram or it is not in the range of this counting formula, returns -1.

    Parameters:
    histogram - The histogram to analyze
    bucket - The bucket from which the counting must be done
    Returns:
    The count for the specified bucket in the specified histogram, or -1 when there is no such bucket or histogram.

    isStdPrv

    public boolean isStdPrv()
    Returns true if the counting formula can be converted to a standard parameterized random variable, false otherwise.

    A counting formula can be converted to standard parameterized random variable when the set of constraints is big enough to restrict the bound logical variable to a single individual.

    Returns:
    true if the counting formula can be converted to a standard parameterized random variable, false otherwise.

    getSumOutCorrection

    Returns the value of the multinomial defined by the values in buckets from specified histogram.

    Specified by:
    getSumOutCorrection in interface Prv
    Parameters:
    e - The range element in this PRV to be processed.
    Returns:
    The correction factor used in lifted elimination

    getCanonicalForm

    public Prv getCanonicalForm()
    Description copied from interface: Prv
    Returns the Standard PRV associated with this PRV. If it is a counting formula #.A:C [f], returns f, if it is a random variable set f:C, returns f, and if it is a standard prv, returns itself.

    Specified by:
    getCanonicalForm in interface Prv
    Returns:

    remove

    public Prv remove(Term t)
    Returns this counting formula with the specified term removed. The remotion is done by adding a InequalityConstraint involving the bound logical variable from this counting formula and the specified term to the set of constraints.

    Parameters:
    t - The term to "remove"
    Returns:
    This counting formula with the specified term removed

    Returns the Prv associated with this counting formula with the the bound logical variable replaced by the specified term.

    Parameters:
    t - The replacement for the bound logical variable
    Returns:
    the Prv associated with this counting formula with the the bound logical variable replaced by the specified term.

    simplify

    public Prv simplify()
    Returns this counting formula converted to StdPrv, if this conversion is possible. Otherwise, returns this counting formula.

    Returns:
    This counting formula converted to StdPrv, if this conversion is possible. Otherwise, returns this counting formula.

    apply

    public Prv apply(Substitution s)
    Description copied from interface: Prv
    Returns an Instance of this Parameterized Random Variable by applying a substitution.

    The application of a substitution θ ={X1/ti1....,Xl/til} to a parameterized random variable f(t1,...,tk), written f(t1,...,tk)[θ], is a parameterized random variable that is the original parameterized random variable f(t1,...,tk) with every occurrence of Xj in f(t1,...,tk) replaced by the corresponding tij.

    The parameterized random variable f(t1,...,tk)[θ] is called an Instance of f(t1,...,tk) [Kisynski, 2010]. Note that Instance does not have the same meaning as 'instance' in OOP.

    Specified by:
    apply in interface Prv
    Specified by:
    apply in interface Replaceable<Prv>
    Parameters:
    s - A substitution that will be applied to this Parameterized Random Variable.
    Returns:
    An Instance of this Parameterized Random Variable.

    applyToPrv

    public Prv applyToPrv(Substitution s)
    Returns the result of applying a substitution to the parameterized random variable of this counting formula.

    Parameters:
    s - The substitution to be made.
    Returns:
    The parameterized random variable associated with this counting formula with the specified substitution applied.

    increaseCount

    public RangeElement increaseCount(int hIndex,
                                  RangeElement e,
                                  int n)
    Adds the specified amount to the bucket of the specified histogram.

    This method does not modify this counting formula, all operations are made on copies of elements from this counting formula.

    Parameters:
    hIndex - The index of the histogram in the range of this counting formula
    e - The bucket where addition will be made
    n - The amount to add
    Returns:
    The histogram with the specified amount added to the specified bucket.

    Parameters:

    Returns:

    toStdPrv

    public Prv toStdPrv()
    Converts this counting formula to a standard parameterized random variable when its bound logical variable is constrained to a single individual.

    If conversion is not possible, returns this counting formula.

    Returns:
    This counting formula converted to a standard parameterized random variable.
